description:
COVIS data

Data are collected at local level and clinically confirmed cases of any Vibrio infection (any species) are reported to the COVIS system (Cholera and Other Vibrio Surveillance). 

COVIS surveillance reports allow for the reporting of metadata including: patient information, geographic location of isolation, type of infection (wound, blood, gastrointestinal), source of exposure, species confirmed, foreign travel, food consumption, etc. Completeness in reporting of clinical information, epidemiological information, clinical information and seafood trace-back currently ranges from 21% - 71%.

For more information, see: http://www.cdc.gov/ncezid/dfwed/PDFs/nat-covis-surv-overview-508c.pdf
name: Confirmed vibrio infections
